conclusion: Analyze the process in the p/V diagram using the ideal gas law to find temperature at state B.
p/V diagram shows process from A to B with constant volume, then to C along hyperbola, returning to D.
Temperature at state A is 300 K.
Process from A to B is isochoric (constant volume).
Ideal gas law: PV = nRT, with V constant, p ‚àù T.
Temperature at B is calculated using T_A since volume is constant: T_B = T_A = 300 K.
Diagram indicates temperature remains constant from A to B.
Temperature at B is the same as at A.
Final answer: Temperature at B is 300 K.
